title: Health Insurance Provider 'MediGuard' Settles Data Leak Case for $8.2M
author: Sarah Johnson

content.intro: MediGuard, a leading health insurance company, has reached an $8.2 million settlement after a 2023 leak exposed patients' medical and financial records.

sections.title: What Data Was Exposed?
sections.content: The breach included medical histories, insurance IDs, billing details, and even some patientsâ€™ prescription records.

sections.title: Compensation Details
sections.content: Affected individuals can claim up to $3,000 for out-of-pocket losses (such as fraudulent medical bills) and an additional $150 for general damages.

sections.title: New Security Measures
sections.content: MediGuard will now conduct annual third-party security audits and provide free identity theft protection for five years.
